poem:
**Veiled Blossoms**

In secret alcoves,  
whispered petals unfurl—  
fingers paint whispers  
in quiet rebellion.  
  
Behind shrouded doors,  
the dance of brushes,  
a muted melody,  
defies the edict of dusk.  
  
Hushed laughter lingers,  
a perfume of resistance—  
a beauty untamed,  
defiant as the morning light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Taliban launch crackdown on Afghanistan’s secret beauty salons The Taliban have issued an order targeting underground beauty salons operating in secret across Afghanistan, warning the women running them that they have one month to stop or face arrest. Officially, all beauty salons were closed by the Taliban in August 2023, shuttering 12,000 businesses with the loss of more than 50,000 female beautician jobs. Yet clandestine salons have continued to operate within communities across the country.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
